reason: The statement claims phi(m) >= 0 for m in M, but phi maps to C (complex numbers). Complex numbers are not ordered - there is no natural ordering on C that makes >= well-defined. This is a fundamental type error. Either: (1) phi should map to R, or (2) the statement should require phi(m) to be real for all m in M, then phi(m) >= 0 makes sense.
